name: mixed_motivation
description: Mixed Motivation - ownership creates self-interest conflicts
story: Moderate spread rate (β=0.3), extinguish efficiency (κ=0.5), and work cost (c=0.6) create a balanced scenario where ownership bonuses/penalties introduce conflicting motivations. Agents must balance helping neighbors against protecting their own houses, creating opportunities for both cooperation and defection.
research_questions: Do agents prioritize their own houses over team welfare?
Can cooperation emerge despite selfish incentives?
What signaling strategies help coordinate mixed motivations?
How does ownership affect team composition preferences?
